author: Jeffrey M.

description: Cool spot. They had a pretty vast selection of beers on tap but unfortunately none of them appealed to me so I got one of my favorite beers they had in a bottle. Avery white rascal. Great beer and glad they had it.
author: Evan L.

description:
Out of 24 reviews, the only two reviews giving this place less than 3 stars base their reviews on not being open on Sunday and not serving west coast beers. Really? 

This place serves about 20 beers on tap (plenty many more in bottles) and occasionally has free food available for patrons (i.e. Paxti's pizza). On top of that, this place features breweries (currently Deschutes) that will feature several beers on tap and have giveaways like free pint glasses with beer or quality key chains. The beers rotate quite frequently and based on the season so check back in often (or check their FB page or Twitter for latest beer menus, drinks specials, and giveaways etc.)

The owners are knowledge and will make solid recommendations to your liking in case you have any questions or would just like to try something new.
author: E E.

description: Good selection of beer. I liked that they had wine & cider as well. I wish they had more of a food selection. It's a good spot for a quick after-work drink.
author: Cassandra F.

description:
What a welcome addition to the Civic Center Happy Hour scene!  So welcome, in fact, that I may have been to this bar three times in the last week... no comment...

The staff is friendly and knowledgable (the owners' last name is Hall... get it?  get it?), the space is warm and inviting, and the rotating beer selection couldn't be better.  Everything you find on their giant beer wall is available chilled, and there are even a number of beers you can only find on tap here, like their Beer Hall ESB.  Personally, I am having a mild love affair with the St. Bernardus Abt 12 Quad.  Can't wait to see what they do with the food program and wine list as the business continues to grow!
author: Sarah J.

description: We stopped by with a party of 5 for happy hour. At 5:30 PM it was easy to get a seat for everyone in this small establishment although in about an hour it was quite crowded. I enjoyed how personalized the service was, allowing each patron to sample a variety of beers before making his or her final selection. They are a little light on the food offerings--pretty much just kettle corn and a few panini sandos--but to be fair their main focus is on the beer. I enjoyed my first visit and I will definitely be back.
author: Lou S.

description: Great beers on draft (check out that triple IPA! :o), really pleasant service, and tasty little bites (panini and such). I booked the place for a group of 20 just 1 day in advance and they were extremely accommodating in making space for us and ensuring that we had all our needs met. Will definitely return!
author: Ted M.

description:
This is my go-to spot to grab a beer after work. Awesome selection of beer, cozy place & fun employees. It can get a little loud in there but overall it's a fun spot.

Ideal spot to pregame before a show at bill graham. Just make sure you grab a burger beforehand!
author: Christina A.

description: This place is an especially nice because of the lighting. With the slogan "Revitalizing mid-market 1 beer at a time", this place lives up to its claim. I recommend the collaboration, a Belgian Tripel. The service was great because the bartenders are very knowledgeable about their beer. If you work around mid-market, stop by for a drink with a friend. Also a great place to continue your night after the symphony or the opera. Lastly, take advantage of their 20% off deal for beers to go.
author: Blake W.

description:
So happy to have a place that rivals City Beer Store right in my neighborhood! I loved the beer selection, both on tap (the brandywine was the best I've ever had!), and in the bottle. They have a 5-6 page printout (with tiny print) of their copious bottle offerings, which means that my husband will be stopping here instead of the overpriced corner stores to bring something home from now on. :) 

I liked the ambience, and the staff were great. The only things that could make the place better are happy hour prices if they don't already have them (even if happy hour is later, since it was already super packed at 6:30 but winding down by 8:30), and of course, noshing options. I'll definitely be here often!
author: Jen R.

description:
I expected more on tap for a place called the Beer Hall. Several of the spots on the 20 tap menu were blank, presumably because they had run out during the week (we visited on a Friday night). There were also no small bites and limited seating in a place that filled quickly.

The beer selection in bottle form is very extensive and full of great choices. The menu is segregated by types which is helpful if you are looking to try something new. Overall, solid place for a drink.
author: Jacob L.

description: Best beers in SF!! No doubt about it. Great selection.  Strong tasting!  It's a small place but it has a good vibe and I have always found it very enjoyable
author: Francisco B.

description: A good choice of beers, a nice ambience, and a friendly barmaid! It's a good location to indulge your taste in beer. Only concern: some of the prices are kind of steep for beers... but hey, this is SF and everything is expensive anyway.
author: Sebastien C.

description:
Beer hall was way smaller than I expected nestled in the randomosity that is Civic Center/Twitterhood.

The bad is that they only have a tiny TV in the corner, but there's plenty good to make up for it. Large tap list, delicious food (turkey panini and spiced nuts), though you will still feel hungry afterwards. The staff are all really awesome. They'll bring your drinks to you when you order at the bar.

Cozy atmosphere. Arriving at 5:30 on a weeknight is no problem, you'll have a table and beat the rush. 

Always excited to try new beer spots in the city!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Nice place, decent bottle selection (nothing crazy), good beer spread on tap.  A little tight and a little pricey.  Great bathroom.  Friendly staff.  Loud as shit when crowded.

They don't update their beer menu online, so you sorta have to cross your fingers and hope for the best when you show up.   Worth checking out, but not worth a special trip.
author: Dave H.

description:
Stopped by here after the Giants Parade. The dual combination of coming on the day of the parade and Halloween made it quite busy and lively inside, but still my buddy and I managed to grab a table. Very good tap selection, and was pleased to see them offering a pumpkin beer (T.R.E.A.T.) for the holiday, but was blown away by the Boulder Choco Shake on nitro.
They do offer table service, which was very nice and a rarity for a place so small. My only complaint, and lack of a fifth star, is they are a bit pricy. The bottle selection on the wall was especially apparent of this. Definitely worth the stop however. Recommended
author: C B.

description:
The BEST new addition to the neighborhood.  Mr and Mrs. Hall have outdone themselves creating a space that is ideal for conversation (the background music never overwhelms) as well as for meetings.  Streamlined, sleek and easy on the eye, the environment alone had me sold on making this one of our regular haunts.  Gotta love a place that has an interesting video playing in the lav.

Now, for the beer ... Such a great selection and so well thought out.  I could bring any beer snob along with me and we would all have ample options.  One of the few places in town that does their best to always have a porter on tap.  Major kudos for that!  Very impressed with Drew Hall's attention to variety of beer styles.  No matter how you feel about ciders, he always makes sure to have a good one for those serious cider lovers.  

We are sold on this place.  Caveat:  5:30pm becomes a madhouse when the local businessfolk descend upon Beer Hall.  Arrive much earlier OR much later.
author: Joe W.

description: Great neighborhood spot, 20 beers on tap, 100s of bottles available. Very knowledgable and friendly staff.
author: Ryan E.

description:
That's the beer list.  Please give me something I might actually want to drink. There is still nothing better than a nice IPA, and not a single offering of a classic west coast beer.

Spare me and we give you two years max if your lucky until you close down. Give us something good, great beer, service, atmosphere, but not this!
author: Bill K.

description: I perhaps could do less with pumpkin beer and more with a bitter, but bitter would I be without the Beer Hall in my neighborhood, especially given that you can order in from Little Griddle (with a reuben that one should not overlook).
author: Laurel B.

description: Lovely environment and great selection of beer. A special shoutout to Sam the bartender for being incredibly nice!
author: Caroline F.

description:
Came here for SF beer week and the place was so cute (and crowded). We were lucky to find a table for too. Their Beer Week event was set up like a blind taste test and they had raffles during the event as well. Never found out which beers we liked the best but that's ok. There was a little snafu with the bill but they corrected it immediately.

Definitely will want to come back!
author: Aneilia M.

description: Was expecting this to be somewhat yuppie when I walked in, as a friend picked out our meeting spot. Was pleasantly surprised by the chill atmosphere, great beer, and the bartender's knowledge about the beers on tap. The dish of olives was super yummy and make the craft beer taste even better. Gets pretty crowded at happy hour, so arrive early if you want a place to sit.
author: Mike D.

description: Off the beaten path and tucked away on a street with almost no other retail shops, a good find for a wide selection of beer on tap and in bottle.
author: Canuck W.

description: Nice place. Small but cool. Nice digital menu. Great beer. Can get very loud after about 6:30.
author: Dion G.

description:
New place in town, 20 beers on tap. 280 on the bottle list.

Quite, hasn't become a scene yet. Mostly local or Twitter folks drop in for a drink.

Friendly staffs, and you can bring outside food in as they only serve delicious beer that will wash down whatever you are eating smoothly.

Only downside, the place close at 11pm!
author: Alice C.

description: The Beer Hall is a fun little beer bar at the intersection of Market and Polk. I stopped in right at 5pm on a Friday to grab some beers to go.  The place was pretty packed and very loud, but given the timeframe I understand.  The taplist was diverse and filled with quality offerings, and the bottle selection was also very good.
author: Matt G.

description: This place is the best!  Close to work and so easy to swing by on the way home.  The owners and staff are super nice and generous!  They try to cater their selection to the unique and adventurous taste.  Lots of options from ciders, beers on tap, bottles, and even wine.  The small plates are also tasty snacks.
author: Elise A.

description:
My fiance and I were in SF for Pride this past weekend, and decided to check out some of the surrounding bars and restaurants when things got really crowded at the festival.

The Beer Hall was hands-down our favorite. I'm a huge beer geek, so seeing their huge selection and getting to talk to their knowledgeable staff about their different brews was a great experience. I ended up sticking with the Fuchschen Alt. My fiance is a big fan of Bloody Marys, and they were running a Pride special on them, so they stuck with the hard stuff. The Mary was spicy and delicious.

We live up north of the bay, but we'll definitely be back to this place again next time we're looking for a good drink in the city.
author: Amanda B.

description: SF beer week ipa flights & tasting competition. Cozy space, conveniently located, lots of offerings. Come here for the beer not the food.
author: Katie L.

description: I enjoy simple, cool and casual.  Beer choices are decent and it's all good for my taste.  Nothing nicer than beer in a brandy or cognac sniffer!
author: Daniel S. C.

description: Great first drink and first impressions. I'll be back with friends next time. Love the location.
author: Robert F.

description: It's hard not to appreciate truth in advertising. It's also nice to see that very rare Young's Double Chocolate Stout on tap.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Came here to check out a World Cup game after Pride

Let's begin with the good: They have a great beer selection and the space is really modern and pretty.  People seemed to be festive and the place gave off that friendly vibe.

The bad: The beers were  over priced for my price range but I guess you pay for good selection. Also, I got charged for club soda which I know is fair but come on, have some love for the designated drivers.

Normally, I'm told, they don't have food and we came on a day they were testing out a new vendor.  The food was astoundingly gross.  BUT you're not likely to have to experience that if you check out Beer Hall in the future.

Service was slow and inattentive.  Never checked on how we were doing.  Granted the place was packed.  If I was in the neighborhood I'd be happy to give it another try.  Definitely a cool concept in the area with lots of potential
author: Meg M.

description: One of my go-to beer places when in SF.   Very good bottle selection, and good draught selection with 20 taps and which seems to rotate often.  Small space so it is intimate, but can also be crowded and loud.
author: Tom M.

description: Nice atmosphere, great selection of beer, great prices, nice and helpful bartender. I'm very glad I discovered this place. I spent some time marveling at the beer bottles on their shelves, before eventually sharing three large 22oz bottles with four friends for less than $40 total.
author: Yiannis S.

description: They have a good selection of beers on tap and bottled. The staff was pretty helpful, and I like the ambience, though the place was a bit small for the crowd it draws. I wish they served snacks though. Worth a visit if you're in the area, but not a special trip.
author: Jiselle L.

description:
This place has so much potential.  Already forming great events like today's release of Velvet Merkin.  Big fan of the digital menu too.

Unfortunately, that's where it ends.  Their bottled beers for purchase are ridiculously overpriced!  They were selling Seizoen Bretta for $16+, this farmhouse ale is usually $12 at City Beer Store and often $10-11 at other small spots.

Word of advice: Don't assume your location is sufficient rationalization for such a premium markup.  The beer geeks you want to attract can take their money to more affordable places in the city.
author: Aalok P.

description:
A small place, but with friendly service and great selection of beer.  The staff was helpful and made good suggestions.  

The decor was fun and music was at an average volume so I could still carry on a conversation with friends.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: This is a great addition to my otherwise sketchy neighborhood. Friendly service and a great eclectic beer selection.
author: Brian M.

description: Deceptive name.  The place is very small.  There beer selection was good and service was pretty fast considering how crowded it was.  I would come back.
author: Ryan H.

description:
I love this place. It combines dive and class beautifully, which is even reflected in the price of their beers; they tend to be very cheap or very expensive, with not too much in the middle.

Friendly, attentive staff with a ton of great suggestions for every taste. Best of all, of course, is their fantastic variety and quality of beers from all over for every palate. While snobs will be satisfied, it's also very easy to find something for everyone, including the very casual crowd.

The only negatives I can think of for this place are 1) no food (I'm not sure why, probably it would mess up their simple execution style)
and
2) So low-key that it's easy to miss even if you walk right by it outside. Seriously, I often have to wait outside to meet friends and guide them in because it's so nondescript and the sign is so small. Could use a marketer.

Overall, though, I love this place, and whenever I'm nearby I try and stop in.
author: Ned D.

description: Located in downtown SF, parking was surprisingly easy.  The friendly bar tender was willing to pour tastes all day until we found the ones we liked.  With such a large selection of beers be patient cause it can take a while (but that's where the fun is)!  Genuinely, I didn't have a beer I didn't enjoy...highly recommend.
author: Chris C.

description: Great beers on tap and available to-go. Not much space inside, but if you can arrive before the techies at Twitter, you should be able to score a seat.
author: Michele K.

description: Great new beer place with an interesting selection of beers on tap, nice ambiance/decor, and a cool video of 1906 San Francisco playing projected on the wall in the bathoroom!  I'll be back here again for sure.
author: David W.

description: Absolutely love this place! Amazing atmosphere and knowledgeable staff. Beer selection is above and beyond anything I've ever soon. Amanda is smart, hardworking and a beer expert! I LOVE THIS PLACE!
author: Patrick M.

description: Awesome selection of a huge variety of beer. A much needed craft beer bar that is bound to become a staple of the neighborhood. Really just well done through and through, from the beer wall to the live updated tap list. This place gets excellent and hard to find kegs that range all over the beer palate. Fresh "Drink By..." IPA from Stone? You had me hello.
author: Jesse N.

description: I don't Yelp very much, but when I do, I find myself in 5 star places. Today I find myself amongst friends here at the Beer Hall. Both of the employees kindly took time to explain the menu and were genuinely nice to talk to. We were looking for a cool bar before jumping on BART to the airport and this place was the perfect place.
author: R C.

description: Great, new spot with very friendly and knowledgeable staff. It's a small and cozy place that has over 200 beers available including about 24 on tap. Hopefully, they will get a kitchen soon as they have food trucks coming by once a week right now.
author: Jared C.

description: If you like beer... You're home!  This place has over 200 beers and great service. We were greeted at the door and they suggested a couple new beers based on our taste.  Great place.
author: Mike Z.

description: If you're looking for a place to hangout for a couple of drinks after work, this is the place to be. You get to choose from a variety of beer options. If you find yourself confused at any time, speak to the staff and they'll always be ready to help you out. The prices are reasonable. The place is open from 4-11pm, but it is closed on Sunday, which can be a bit dissapointing for many beer lovers...:D
author: Dinkar K.

description: I would definitely come back. Great selection and atmosphere. Good amounts of shared and private tables. Near perfect bar execution.
author: The S.

description: Too many four stars...this place is a 6 star joint.  best staff, best beer, great food.
author: Charles C.

description: My new favorite beer place in SF.  It's got the selection of city beer store, but actually nice and comfortable inside.  Plus there seem to be a few less beer nerds and even a big tv.  I wish I lived/worked closer so I could hit it more often!
author: W W.

description: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this up-market (literally, its on Market!) Beer Hall.  Not a dive bar, but a true Beer Hall where the owner works behind the bar and all the staff are VERY knowledgeable about their "over 200" Beer selection.  Yes you read right... over 200 beer brands and available for take out!  I had the Dog-patch Sour which after being told where it comes from, how its made and other beers it would compliment I am a true fan!  Wishing you all the best on your new venture guys.
author: Simon S.
